Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (very worn); from top, two bands of lotus buds in added white outline and added red centres between red and white bands; band of red vertical strokes above single red band; in tondo, rosette with red and white petals; exterior: reserved with brown bands.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the exterior and interior decoration, see Louvre E8056 bis.17.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 98, no. 302.1, pl. XXXII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1604) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 210, no. 6)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5944 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
